replies.body:
More Lux and Ezreal skins lmao, Ivern called, he want's more than 1 skin despite being 2 years old.

Ezreal and Miss Fortune both have 8 skins+.

I don't mean this as an excuse but Riot tends to give skins to champions who fulfill a few different criteria. One is easy/simple spells to animate, another is an easy/simple model and the last is popularity. 

Lux and Ezreal are two of the most popular champions and have very simple models making reskinning them fairly easy. Their spells also aren't crazy complicated either meaning you can redo them decently quick, it's part of why Ahri also has like a billion skins: she's popular and her spells aren't complicated to make variations of. 

Ivern has a complicated model since he doesn't obey standard proportions for a human, well his spells aren't complicated his ultimate requires a second model to be made for each skin because of Daisy which adds more work, and his popularity isn't insane either, on Champion.gg he's sitting at 137/207 in terms of play rate with a play rate of 0.98%, as context Jungle Twitch has a 1.66% play rate. I don't agree with it, I'm just explaining Riot's logic behind who gets skins
Rek'sai called. She's 4 years old in less than a month, and only has one non-release skin.
Elderwood Rek'sai or a Snow-tunneling one sounds cool imo
These aren't real skins.

Uh, but they are though? While the particle effects arent different, they did have to make an entire new model, which yes, while it was based off of the star guardian skins, they still take a longer time because theyre not chromas and really are a 'new' skin with an entirely new model

jungle always gets changed every preseason. Junglers are not weak willed people. Too much abuse from laners for that . We already know that everyone who plays jungle can put up with it. jungles get flamed-ed just cause people can't cs or path to turret.

{{sticker:sg-zephyr}}

Honestly really disappointed you guys chose not to go for 4 options in the middle rune stat path row, it's sad champs like {{champion:19}} and {{champion:102}} can't get 18% attack speed at the cost of AD but mages that took precision secondary before can now get 20 AP without really giving up anything. 

Not having some small amount of % movespeed somewhere in the stat tree was also sad, but I suppose that makes more sense.

I don't particularly understand the design philosophy of Runes anymore. It feels like we've gone back to to the prior Runes and Masteries system, but with less diverse paths in the opposite tree and the only benefit is ease of customization over actual customization. 

Where Runes were extremely diverse and we could customize all the stats we wanted, and the Masteries were bland but marginally effective in their own way. Now it is Masteries that are diverse [the regular precision/sorcery paths and such] and very, almost excessively, effective; but the Runes (which is now the stat tree choice) are extremely limited and preloaded. 

It has gone full circle, but limited freedom in exchange for a better UI, which could have easily been applied to either prior iteration. At this point, reverting Runes Reforged seems even more attractive, albeit not as feasible nor suggested. But going wholeheartedly with that older philosophy and redesigning it as such feels much more effective than forcing whatever design this had in mind which always falls short as well as causes so many balance issues, damage creep, and stunted variability in the game.

Even when we had the ability to customize the hell out of everything - and pick up a 1% crit rune because it was broken as hell - everyone picked the same runes for a particular champion because that's what worked best.  Having so many options like the old system is just fun for Min/Max'ers, but for filthy casuals like myself, I'd rather have a simple system that I can still customize, and it actually makes sense when I read the tooltips.
This.  Hate the direction runes are going in.
But...but...Pajama Guardian Poppy could LITERALLY throw a pillow for her buckler. I feel like Riot missed out on a great opportunity here...
Riot has heard us before like with the Karma rework skins, and most recently with KD/A Akali's neon shroud. Throwing a pillow would be funny as hell.

Poppy's Ragdoll Poppy skin already throws a pillow in place of the shield.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8vIsUjC4jQ

I'm not sure if they changed this, but newly released champions are usually 7800 blue essence for the first week and then reduced down to 6300.

Leave Yorick alone already, First you Nerf Ghoul damage because people aggro the ghouls that are like minions and take free dmg to them because even Normal minion aggro is barely existant at toplane and the range is so short someone can AA you from range and use targetted spells and the minions just sit there.
Normal minions and The ghouls, and after nerfing their dmg because people ignore them.
You nerf his ability to push a lead by sieging with his ghouls, but now everytime they hit an enemy we have to back off constantly.
Fix bugs that hinder him, not ~~"Bugs"~~ Nerfs that just make him worse.
What about Irelia? Akali? Leblanc? Khazix? Kaisa? Seriously...
Literally every other champion that has a similar ability (Malazahar W) draws turret aggro onto themselves... it should be the same for yorick.

Look at Akali's win rate lol........ 
(https://champion.gg/champion/Akali/Middle?league=)

champion.gg is inaccurate, just look at the banrates for champions. There's no way the highest banrate is 7%. If you look at Op.gg or LeagueOfGraphs, their banrates are more in tune to what the actual statistics are. And besides, If I was an Akali main and my champion was banned 60% of the time, I'd want my champion to be nerfed, or changed at the very least so I can play my champion. One of the sites I just listed has her having a high diamond+ banrate of 75%. If high elo players are banning her that much, she's unbalanced.

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/by-banrate

http://na.op.gg/champion/statistics

I wouldn't say she's necessarily "unbalanced" but more of the Zoe issue from before. Zoe had < 50% win rate and wasn't OP by any means, but it was just SO F*CKING FRUSTRATING to play against her. Akali takes that to another extreme by not even being able to target her with the shroud component. Her win rate is fine, though still maybe overturned for the best Akali players, but definitely leaning more on the side of unfun rather than unbalanced.
Well...she is unbalanced, too many options.

And hopefully completely reverted because they were honestly just hell to deal with.
Again, they are returning for more testing in 8.24 so no, not reverted.

And ANOTHER failed patch.

You have failed to address the most troublesome problem with the game right now:  UNBALANCED MATCHMAKING.

Since you changed the matchmaking in March 2018, games have snowballed very early, and players have become EXTREMELY frustrated with the UNFUN nature of your game.  Why?  Because you are creating matches with all or most of the inexperienced players on one side, and all or most of the skilled players on the other side.

When you create unbalanced teams, guess what happens?  One team grabs a very early advantage, and the game is decided within six minutes as the score is already 6 to 1, or worse.

Guess what happens after?  The game snowballs out of control, players give up and become more and more toxic, and it's a clownfest.  Not fun for the noobies, not fun for the skilled players.  Just a boring massacre, whichever side of the teeter totter you are on.

FIX THE MATCHMAKING.  FIX THE MATCHMAKING.  FIX THE MATCHMAKING.  We have been waiting almost 7 years now for you to fix it.  Take care of it.

Match noobies against noobies.  All noobies on both teams.  Match skilled players against skilled players.  All skilled players on both teams.

Once you fix matchmaking, THEN start worrying about tweaking things like early game, game duration, and so on.

Your game has many problems right now, and it has a declining and unhappy player base.  Make the game fun, this is the most important thing you need to focus on.  Once your player base is having fun playing in fun matches again, THEN you can start working on the myriad unbalancing issues you have created over the past three years.

lmao that guinsoo's rework is trash. wth is going on here?  Can we please revisit the original direction of it's first form?

Thje original gave AD and AP and stacked with attacks and ability casts granting additional attackspeed and AP.  It was a bad item that only a few could use but what it was trying to accomplish wasn't bad.

This is a joke item even for an on-hit build
